ci_support_linux_64_cuda_compilercuda-nv:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- cos7
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cuda_compiler:
- cuda-nvcc
cuda_compiler_version:
- '12.0'
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '12'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-cos7-x86_64
numpy:
- '2.0'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
pytorch:
- '2.5'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - cxx_compiler_version
  - c_stdlib_version
  - cdt_name
  - cuda_compiler
  - cuda_compiler_version
  - docker_image
- - python
  - numpy

about.description:
Fully convolutional one-stage object detection (FCOS) is a framework for
per-pixel prediction of objects in images. FCOS doesn't rely on expensive
anchor box calculations and their hyper-parameters, which is in contrast to
state-of-the-art object detectors like RetinaNet, YOLOv3, and Faster R-CNN.
It includes a Python API, & scripts for command line usage.
about.summary: FCOS is a detector for efficiently predicting objects in images

about.description:
Fully convolutional one-stage object detection (FCOS) is a framework for
per-pixel prediction of objects in images. FCOS doesn't rely on expensive
anchor box calculations and their hyper-parameters, which is in contrast to
state-of-the-art object detectors like RetinaNet, YOLOv3, and Faster R-CNN.
It includes a Python API, & scripts for command line usage.
about.summary: FCOS is a detector for efficiently predicting objects in images

name: fcos
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.9.8" %}

{% set cuda_major = environ.get("cuda_compiler_version", "11.8").split(".")[0] | int %}

package:
  name: fcos
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/f/fcos/fcos-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 1fe061baf2efcd77f78ac7ce8731deace99d6dad5a592387b2b8dab930a95d3a
  patches:
    - patches/0001-fix-renamed-import-from-torch.hub.patch

build:
  number: 10
  skip: true  # [not linux]
  # GPU-only package
  skip: true  # [cuda_compiler_version == "None"]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - {{ compiler('cuda') }}
    - ninja
  host:
    - pip
    - python
    - pytorch
    - pytorch *=cuda*
    - numpy
    - ninja
    - setuptools
    {% if cuda_major >= 12 %}
    - libcublas-dev
    - libcusolver-dev
    - libcusparse-dev
    {% endif %}
  run:
    - acrv_datasets
    - py-opencv
    - pycocotools
    - python
    - torchvision
    - yacs
    # actually a run-dep of acrv_datasets
    - setuptools
  run_constrained:
    - pytorch *=cuda*

test:
  imports:
    - fcos

about:
  home: https://github.com/best-of-acrv/fcos
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: FCOS is a detector for efficiently predicting objects in images
  description: |
    Fully convolutional one-stage object detection (FCOS) is a framework for
    per-pixel prediction of objects in images. FCOS doesn't rely on expensive
    anchor box calculations and their hyper-parameters, which is in contrast to
    state-of-the-art object detectors like RetinaNet, YOLOv3, and Faster R-CNN.
    It includes a Python API, & scripts for command line usage.
  doc_url: https://github.com/best-of-acrv/fcos
  dev_url: https://github.com/best-of-acrv/fcos

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - btalb
    - mikemhenry
    - h-vetinari
